type.context: MEDEX ACT under Short title. 1.  This Act may be cited as the Medex Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Interpretation. 2.  In this Act  approved programme means a programme for the training of persons for registration as medex approved by the Minister and organised for the purposes of this Act by the University of Guyana acting in conjunction with the Ministry; LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 32:04 Medex   L.R.O. 1/2012  Cap. 134  1953 Ed.                       Registration of medex.      Persons to whom section 3 applies.                the Board means the Medical Board established by section 16 of the Colonial Medical Service Ordinance;   medex means a person who is  (a)     certified    by   the   University   of  Guyana  as  having successfully undergone a course of training in the approved programme; and  (b)   is  registered  under  this  Act  for  the  purpose  of performing specific medical services as an officer in the public service;  the register means the register of medex kept by the secretary pursuant to section 3;  the secretary means the Secretary of the Board.

type.title: Registration of medex.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Registration of medex. 3. The Board shall, upon the application of any person to whom this section applies, direct the secretary to enter the name of that person in a register of medex kept by the secretary for the purpose.

type.name: section
type.title: Persons to whom section 3 applies.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Persons to whom section 3 applies. 4. Section 3 applies to any person who is eligible for registration as a medex under this Act by satisfying the Board  (a)      that he is of good character;  (b)       that he is certified by the University of Guyana as having successfully undergone a course of   training in the approved programme; or  (c)      that  he holds a certificate granted by an institution in a place outside Guyana and recognised for the  time LAWS OF GUYANA Medex Cap. 32:04 5      L.R.O.  1/2012                        L.R.O. 1/2012                 Services medex may perform.                                being by the Board as furnishing a sufficient guarantee of the possession by him of the  requisite knowledge and skill to perform efficiently the functions which may be performed  by a medex under this Act; and  (d)     that  he  is  employed,  or  has  been  selected for employment, in the public service.

type.name: section
type.title: Services medex may perform.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Services medex may perform. 5. (1) A medex may perform, under the supervision of a duly registered medical practitioner designated by the Minister for the purpose, such medical services for which the medex has been trained under the approved programme and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions of this subsection may, in particular  (a)    advise members of the public on the            promotion of health generally and the           prevention of disease;  (b)     administer  pre-natal  and post-natal care and advise members of the public on routine child care;  (c)       diagnose and manage certain common ailments and identify such ailments as need referral to the supervising medical practitioner, or in an emergency directly to a hospital;   (d)      perform normal  deliveries  of  babies  and identify abnormalities which need to be  referred to the supervising medical  practitioner or to a hospital. type.name: section
type.title: Publication of list of medex registered and correction of register.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Publication of list of medex registered and correction of register. 6. (1) In the month of February in each year the secretary shall publish in the Gazette a list of the names of those persons then registered as medex.  (2) The secretary shall from time to time, insert in the register any alteration in the name or address of any medex registered coming to his knowledge and delete the name of every deceased medex.

type.name: section
type.title: Removal of names of medex from the register.
type.context: MEDEX ACT under Removal of names of medex from the register. 7. (1) The Board may remove from the register for such period as the  Board  may  determine  in  the  circumstances  of  the  case,  or permanently, the name of any registered medex who is convicted of an offence  on indictment or who, after due inquiry by the Board, is adjudged by the Board to have been negligent in the performance of his functions as a medex, or to have been guilty of any misconduct in connection therewith.  (2) The removal of the name of a medex from the register under this section shall be published in the Gazette.
